isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 530 Engine Diagnostic Manual for 4000 Series Trucks (2001) - DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - TOOLS - DWYER SLACK TUBE MANOMETER

svcsubproc.title: Description
svcsubproc.para: The manometer is a "U" shaped tube with a scale mounted between the legs of the U. Where the portability of the Model 200 Pressure Test Kit is not required, this manometer can be used to measure either low pressure or vacuum (intake restriction, crankcase pressure or exhaust back pressure) and must be filled with water. Refer to Dwyer Slack Tube Manometer .

svcsubproc.title: Filling
svcsubproc.para: The manometer must be filled with water before checking any pressure.

When filling with water, use only good drinking water without additives, except for some colored water vegetable dye, which enables the tester to read the scale easier. With both legs of the manometer open to the atmosphere, fill the tube until the top of the fluid column is near the zero mark on the scale. Shake the tube to eliminate any air bubbles.

important.para: NEVER USE AN ANTIFREEZE SOLUTION, SODA POP, TONIC, ETC. TO FILL MANOMETER. THE INCREASE IN DENSITY CAUSES FALSE READINGS.

step1.para: Support the manometer in a vertical position. Be sure the fluid level line is in line with the zero indicator on the graduated scale.
Connect one leg of the manometer to the source of the pressure or vacuum. The other leg is left open to atmospheric pressure.
After starting the engine and allowing it to reach its normal operating temperature, it can be set to High Idle. After approximately 10 seconds the manometer can be observed.

Record the average position of the fluid level when it is above and below the zero indicator. Add the two figures together. The sum of the two is the total column of fluid and represents the crankcase pressure in inches of water.
Compare manometer reading with engine specifications.

note.para: At times both columns of the manometer will not travel the same distance. This is of no concern to the tester as long as the leg not connected to the pressure or vacuum source is open to the atmosphere.

step1.para: Wash the tube thoroughly using a little pure soap and water. Avoid liquid soaps and solvents.
